newsitem.title: UK: Boycott to edit UK's Independent on Sunday paper.
newsitem.headline: Boycott to edit UK's Independent on Sunday paper.

text.p: Rosie Boycott has been appointed editor of Britain's Independent On Sunday, officials at the newspaper said on Friday.
Boycott, currently editor of Esquire magazine, will replace Peter Wilby, 51, who is leaving the newspaper after 18 months.
Boycott, who will be the only woman editor of a broadsheet newspaper, is expected to take up her post shortly.
Boycott, 44, launched feminist magazine Spare Rib in the early 1970s and was appointed editor of men's magazine Esquire five years ago.
Latest circulation figures show that the Independent is the weakest seller among Britain's four Sunday "qualities".
Its average sale over the six months to August was slightly under 300,000. The market leading Sunday Times sold an average of 1.29 million copies weekly in the same period.
Mirror Group and Independent Newspapers are the main shareholders in Newspaper Publishing, the company which produces the daily Independent and its Sunday sister.
